def campaign_page(request):
    # Get the user's preferences from cookies
    preferences = request.COOKIES.get('preferences', {})

    # Use the preferences to tailor the campaign messaging
    messaging = {
        'issue_1': 'We understand that you care about issue 1, and we agree. That's why we are committed to addressing it head-on.',
        'issue_2': 'We know that you are concerned about issue 2, and we share your concern. Our solution will help to address this issue in a comprehensive and effective manner.',
        # Add more issues and messaging as needed
    }

    # Render the campaign webpage with the tailored messaging
    return render(request, 'campaign_page.html', {'messaging': messaging})

# Add a URL pattern to the Django router

from . import views

    path('', views.campaign_page, name='campaign_page'),
]

```bash
#!/bin/bash

# Set the email addresses of the people in zip code 12125
people=("john.doe@example.com" "jane.doe@example.com" "john.smith@example.com")

# Set the subject and body of the email for each day
subjects=("Constitutional Convention Request - Day 1" "Constitutional Convention Request - Day 2" "Constitutional Convention Request - Day 3")
bodies=("This is a request for a new constitutional convention. Please consider this request seriously." "This is a reminder of the request for a new constitutional convention. Please take action soon." "This is a final reminder of the request for a new constitutional convention. Please do not ignore this request.")

# Loop through the people and send an email every day
for i in {1..3}; do
  # Set the email account to use for the day
  account=$(echo $people[$i] | awk '{print $1}')

  # Send the email using the appropriate account
  echo "Sending email from $account..."
  mail -s "$subjects[$i]" -b "$bodies[$i]" $people[$i]

  # Print a success message
  echo "Email sent successfully!"
done
```
